title: Smarter insights, stronger teams: New features for Stack Overflow for Teams
author: Carrie Koos
text: April 15, 20252025.3 | Teams Enterprise ReleaseOur April release is all about making knowledge work for you—wherever you are. With actionable insights delivered straight to your preferred platforms, more control over user organization, and subtle UX nudges that encourage meaningful engagement, this update is built to keep your teams informed, aligned, and actively contributing.Let’s dig into what’s new.Microsoft Teams Channel DigestsNow available in Microsoft Teams! These weekly updates surface key activity based on selected tags and communities. You'll see:Top contributors by user and departmentUsage metrics to track engagementUnanswered questions to improve answer rate and close knowledge gapsDelivered straight into your Teams channels, digests help drive adoption and keep team knowledge front and center.Slack Personal DigestsPrefer your updates one-on-one? Slack Personal Digests drop directly into your DMs, highlighting:Relevant content based on your activityKey actions and unanswered questionsYour personal impact on the knowledge baseYou’re always in control—users can toggle personal digests on or off in Slack app settings.Empower your moderators without compromising admin control. Moderators can now:Create, update, and delete user groupsEnsure users are aligned with the content most relevant to themKeep your knowledge base tidy and targetedAdmins still hold the keys to system-wide settings, but moderators now have more room to help organize and engage their communities effectively.Let’s face it: people sometimes forget to vote. So we’re giving your team a gentle push.Unanswered questions now display “Vote” instead of “0” to make the call to action crystal clearTooltips will appear for users who haven’t voted in the last 30 days, nudging them to engage and help surface valuable contentMore votes = better answers = smarter teams. It’s a win all around.This release is about visibility, control, and contribution. Whether you’re digesting insights in Slack or Teams, organizing users into the right groups, or encouraging more interaction with smarter prompts, Stack Overflow for Teams 2025.3 is here to help your team move faster—together.Ready to put these updates to work? html:
April 15, 2025

2025.3 | Teams Enterprise Release

Our April release is all about making knowledge work for you—wherever you are. With actionable insights delivered straight to your preferred platforms, more control over user organization, and subtle UX nudges that encourage meaningful engagement, this update is built to keep your teams informed, aligned, and actively contributing.

Let’s dig into what’s new.

Microsoft Teams Channel Digests

Now available in Microsoft Teams! These weekly updates surface key activity based on selected tags and communities. You'll see:

  • Top contributors by user and department
  • Usage metrics to track engagement
  • Unanswered questions to improve answer rate and close knowledge gaps

Delivered straight into your Teams channels, digests help drive adoption and keep team knowledge front and center.

Slack Personal Digests

Prefer your updates one-on-one? Slack Personal Digests drop directly into your DMs, highlighting:

  • Relevant content based on your activity
  • Key actions and unanswered questions
  • Your personal impact on the knowledge base

You’re always in control—users can toggle personal digests on or off in Slack app settings.

Empower your moderators without compromising admin control. Moderators can now:

  • Create, update, and delete user groups
  • Ensure users are aligned with the content most relevant to them
  • Keep your knowledge base tidy and targeted

Admins still hold the keys to system-wide settings, but moderators now have more room to help organize and engage their communities effectively.

Let’s face it: people sometimes forget to vote. So we’re giving your team a gentle push.

  • Unanswered questions now display “Vote” instead of “0” to make the call to action crystal clear
  • Tooltips will appear for users who haven’t voted in the last 30 days, nudging them to engage and help surface valuable content

More votes = better answers = smarter teams. It’s a win all around.

This release is about visibility, control, and contribution. Whether you’re digesting insights in Slack or Teams, organizing users into the right groups, or encouraging more interaction with smarter prompts, Stack Overflow for Teams 2025.3 is here to help your team move faster—together.

Ready to put these updates to work? Log into your Stack Overflow for Teams instance today and explore the latest improvements!

For additional details on the improvements above and other updates with the latest release, view the 2025.3 release notes.
